author: tomj
msg: Add support for --package <name> switch, including support for auto-generated package names.
The auto-generated names are not exposed on the command line, because they aren't very interesting right now.
They reverse the hostname of the targetNamespace of the WSDL definition tag.  This is often 127.0.0.1.
In the process of adding the -p/--package switch, I started using the Jakarta Avalon project Excalibur's
command line inspection (CLI) class.  This class supports the GNU
style single letter (-p) or double-dash full word (--package) options.
Here is the current usage message (generated by the CLI classes):
Wsdl2java stub generator
Usage: java org.apache.axis.wsdl.Wsdl2java [options] WSDL-URI
Options:
-h, --help
print this message and exit
-v, --verbose
print informational messages
-s, --skeleton
emit skeleton class for web service
-m, --messageContext
emit a MessageContext parameter to skeleton methods
-p, --package <argument>
package to put emitted files in
